text: There was no evidence of any important differences across all prespecified clinical subgroups (history-indicated, ultrasound-indicated).The sole included study1076 comparing cerclage with weekly intramuscular injection of $1 7 \ \alpha \cdot$ hydroxyprogesterone caproate in women with a short cervix detected by transvaginal ultrasound scan was interrupted after 3 years of recruitment because interim analysis did not reveal any obvious differences in obstetric and neonatal outcomes.
